pullrequest.title: Integrating new method for implementing visual and physical wave field.

content.raw:
I think the PR is good. A few suggestions:

1. I’d be tempted to remove the box and wam-v models from wave\_gazebo as the box example does not add a lot in this case and the wam-v example duplicates the meshes from the main robot description package for this project.
2. The tests in wave\_gazebo\_plugins are mostly empty placeholders as the majority of the code in the original versions tested the mesh based buoyancy code which has been removed \(although tests to cover the remainder of the code would be good to have!\).

For the license change, I think the best way to manage that is for me to create a fork of my code matching this PR \(including name changes etc.\) and license the repository under Apache 2.  That gives VRX an original source to refer to with matching license details and I can add a comment regarding the reason for the split licenses \(i.e. dependencies on GPL licenses components in the full version\). I can post that to Bitbucket using mercurial as a VCS if that helps on your side.

  1. I’d be tempted to remove the box and wam-v models from wave_gazebo as the box example does not add a lot in this case and the wam-v example duplicates the meshes from the main robot description package for this project.
  2. The tests in wave_gazebo_plugins are mostly empty placeholders as the majority of the code in the original versions tested the mesh based buoyancy code which has been removed (although tests to cover the remainder of the code would be good to have!).

For the license change, I think the best way to manage that is for me to create a fork of my code matching this PR (including name changes etc.) and license the repository under Apache 2. That gives VRX an original source to refer to with matching license details and I can add a comment regarding the reason for the split licenses (i.e. dependencies on GPL licenses components in the full version). I can post that to Bitbucket using mercurial as a VCS if that helps on your side.
